sub_tasks.requirements: Patient Cohort Construction
Filters for female patients using `gender = 'F'`.
Correctly calculates age at admission and filters for the range 53 to 63 years using `age_at_admission BETWEEN 53 AND 63`.
Identifies and filters for only the first ICU stay per hospital admission using `ROW_NUMBER()` and a `rn = 1` condition.
Database Integration
Correctly joins `patients`, `admissions`, and `icustays` tables using `subject_id` and `hadm_id`.
Correctly joins `procedureevents` to the ICU stay cohort using `stay_id` to link procedures to patients.
Uses a `LEFT JOIN` to integrate sepsis diagnosis data, ensuring the non-sepsis (control) cohort is retained for comparison.
Uses a `LEFT JOIN` to attach the calculated procedure counts to the main cohort, using `COALESCE` to correctly handle patients with zero procedures.
Medical Concept Implementation
Correctly identifies sepsis admissions using ICD codes.
Differentiates between ICD-9 and ICD-10 codes using the `icd_version` column.
Selects appropriate ICD-9 codes for sepsis, such as `9959%` or `78552%`.
Selects appropriate ICD-10 codes for sepsis, such as `A41%`.
Filters procedures to only those occurring within the first 24 hours of the ICU admission time using `starttime BETWEEN cb.intime AND DATETIME_ADD(cb.intime, INTERVAL 24 HOUR)`.
Correctly uses a `CASE` statement to separate the cohort into 'Sepsis' and 'General ICU' groups based on the sepsis diagnosis.
Clinical Analytics
Correctly groups the final result set by the stratified `cohort` column to perform comparative analysis.
Calculates the procedure burden by counting the number of distinct procedures per stay using `COUNT(DISTINCT pe.itemid)`.
Calculates the 75th and 90th percentiles of the procedure burden using `APPROX_QUANTILES(..., 100)[OFFSET(75)]` and `[OFFSET(90)]`.
Calculates the average ICU Length of Stay in days using `AVG(DATETIME_DIFF(cb.outtime, cb.intime, HOUR) / 24.0)`.
Calculates the average hospital mortality as a percentage using `AVG(hospital_expire_flag) * 100`.
